course_title: Psychotherapeutic Interventions Across the Lifespan II
class_notes: Online with synchronous sessions TBD. On campus intensives TBD.
course_description: Students will refine their skills and clinical judgement by applying theoretical content and clinical practice guidelines to individuals and groups across the lifespan with dysfunctional coping patterns and psychiatric disorders. The DSM-5 is used as the basis for diagnostic nomenclature.
prerequisites: NRSG 774D or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 2551, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ONLIN, Meets: Meets Online, Instructor: K. Pfeiffer, Status: Open
